full_text: We will create a new contact role, the audit contact. First, create the entities that define the new subtypes for the audit contact role, which is applied at both the account and the policy level. In Studio, go to Configuration, Config, Extensions, Entity. Right-click Entity. Choose New, Entity. Enter the entity name. Click the entity type drop-down. Select subtype as the entity type. Enter description. Search for, or type in account contact role as the supertype. Create audit contact. Exit is a subtype of account contact role. Right-click Entity again. Click New, Entity. Create policy audit contact. Exit is a subtype of policy contact role. Next, update contact.org. Next, update ContactConfig plugin.gs to enable the new contact role. Press Ctrl plus N. Enter ContactConfig plugin. Open the GOSA file. In Default Config, add the new audit contact role for person type only. The first argument indicates whether the contact type is enabled. The second argument is a list of contact types. In this case, it is person only. The third argument is the account contact role type for the audit contact. The fourth argument is the policy audit contact role type. If there are additional policy contact roles that map to audit contact, add the roles to this argument. If you create a role that only exists at the account level, then omit the fourth argument. Next, create the entity name is the first argument. Next, create the entity name for the new entity. Go to ConfigurationConfig. Right-click Entity Names. Select New, Entity Name. Enter audit contact underscore ext in the Entity field. Select the entity. Click OK. Studio opens audit contact contact.ext.en for the default language. In the editor, enter the code in the Default tab. Hover over the display key in red and click Alt plus Enter. Select Create Display Key if it does not exist. Enter the value for the default language. Enter the value for the display key. Save the display key. Stop the server and restart the Policy Center server after any data model changes. Start the server in debug mode. Login to Policy Center as Alice Applegate. Go to an account. For example, Ray Newton. Go to the Contacts page. Click Create New Contact. The drop-down contains Audit Contact, with the option of New Person Only. Enter required fields and save the new audit contact. You can also edit an existing contact. Go to the Roles tab. Click Add Role. Audit Contact is displayed in the drop-down list. The Audit Contact Role is added to the existing contact. Save the changes. This is the end of demonstration for creating a new contact role.

segments.text: We will create a new contact role, the audit contact. First, create the entities that define the new subtypes for the audit contact role, which is applied at both the account and the policy level. In Studio, go to Configuration, Config, Extensions, Entity. Right-click Entity. Choose New, Entity. Enter the entity name.
Click the entity type drop-down. Select subtype as the entity type. Enter description. Search for, or type in account contact role as the supertype.
Create audit contact. Exit is a subtype of account contact role. Right-click Entity again. Click New, Entity. Create policy audit contact. Exit is a subtype of policy contact role.
Next, update contact.org. Next, update ContactConfig plugin.gs to enable the new contact role. Press Ctrl plus N. Enter ContactConfig plugin.

In Default Config, add the new audit contact role for person type only. The first argument indicates whether the contact type is enabled. The second argument is a list of contact types. In this case, it is person only. The third argument is the account contact role type for the audit contact.

The fourth argument is the policy audit contact role type. If there are additional policy contact roles that map to audit contact, add the roles to this argument. If you create a role that only exists at the account level, then omit the fourth argument.
Next, create the entity name is the first argument. Next, create the entity name for the new entity. Go to ConfigurationConfig. Right-click Entity Names.
Select New, Entity Name. Enter audit contact underscore ext in the Entity field. Select the entity. Click OK.

Studio opens audit contact contact.ext.en for the default language. In the editor, enter the code in the Default tab. Hover over the display key in red and click Alt plus Enter. Select Create Display Key if it does not exist.
Enter the value for the default language. Enter the value for the display key.
Save the display key. Stop the server and restart the Policy Center server after any data model changes.
Start the server in debug mode. Login to Policy Center as Alice Applegate. Go to an account. For example, Ray Newton. Go to the Contacts page. Click Create New Contact.

The drop-down contains Audit Contact, with the option of New Person Only. Enter required fields and save the new audit contact. You can also edit an existing contact. Go to the Roles tab. Click Add Role.
Audit Contact is displayed in the drop-down list. The Audit Contact Role is added to the existing contact. Save the changes. This is the end of demonstration for creating a new contact role.
